updated test java file to recreate problem.

Previous sample java file had unresolvable reverences.

With the changes we've just released to HEAD for another bug yesterday, you no
longer get the log message. But you still have those two classes not being
instantiated. 

Unfortunately the message for the second one is not clear and says Expression
type sent in invalid order, but the real problem with that one is we can't
handle the array argument to the constructor.

The problem with the first one is we don't handle non-static inner classes,
which is what it is in your code.
M1 released, move all resolved to Verified, as prelude to closing.
M1 released, move all resolved/verified to Closed.
